ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I want to study graphic design in college, so this course helped me get a feel for what I would be learning. I learned how to work within constraints and really push my work to the next level. This is the first college course Ive ever taken because I am still in high school so it was a good experience and really pushed me out of my comfort zone to work alongside older students.
A basic knowledge of graphic design. Specifically, a working knowledge of typography and how to design typography to be seen and read.

Because I had never truly used any of adobe's software before, I developed basic skills on multiple platforms by experimenting with the prompts I was given. Additionally I gained more of an eye for what makes good typography and the elements which can be formatted in creating an effective book spread for example.
typography and text-focused graphic design in various formats (posters, books, display)
Gestalt Design Principles

Composition, abstract design principles (GESTALT principles), some design-related history involving graphics, architecture, et cetera. Depth & ordering, typography, color theory, live exhibit work, and so much more.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the instructions for the assignments could have been a little more clear, it was hard to understand what the professor wanted at some points. I enjoyed the content of the work and all the assignments, they were very interesting and I enjoyed them.

The main strength is the structure of the assignments. The constraints are very helpful when starting to create designs. The main weaknesses are that no grade feedback is given so students do not know where they stand. Also, there is little helpful resources on how to use software to create designs. For an intro level class it expects aa high level knowledge of design software.

Of course this course was offered over zoom so I am sure it did not meet its full potential but I think because most of our work in this class was created digitally the breakout rooms were an excellent way to share our work. Sometimes the lecture portion of the class was long but our professor did a nice job of allowing us breaks when we needed them. I think one thing this course would benefit from is more time learning adobe softwares just because it is an "intro" class so some introduction to common softwares would have been nice. Another critique of the course is the amount of feedback we got from the professor, throughout the class I got basic feedback from everyone but it gave me no sense really of how I was doing in the class. I would have appreciated a half-way report of some sort.

hands-on approach was very good.

sharing/critique wasn't always the most helpful because it depended on other students. This isn't to say any contribution wasn't valuable... it's just that some included more disparities and cognitive/design dissonance than others.
I really enjoyed the professor and the way she encourages one to work. It's been very fun!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes I would, if you are interested in digital arts, this class allows you to really push your limits and create some artwork. You get a lot of good feedback from your peers and the information taught by the professor is informative and fun.
I would recommend it if they are interested in typography and have some experience already in graphic design.
Yes, for anyone interested in Graphic design especially around typography this course was a great intro.
Yes! 100% I've wanted to take a course like this for a while and am really glad I did, especially during summer session when I had more time to think about how I wanted to approach the assignments.
Yes! It was an amazing and fun experience.
